Award.AwardTitle: SBIR Phase I: Large Scale And Automated Unsupervised Machine Learning For Anomaly Detection
Award.AbstractNarration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project will result from enabling businesses to process and extract insights from large unlabeled datasets, using machine learning with minimal human supervision, in application areas such as cyber security, precision medicine and predictive maintenance. Current deep learning approaches require large amounts of labeled data. Creation of labeled data is expensive, error prone and time consuming. The proposed software will provide fully automated capabilities for semi-supervised learning for anomaly detection in cyber security applications. All businesses ranging from large scale enterprises to boutique data science consulting firms will benefit from this project. The expected impact can range in the billions of dollars in the areas of cyber security and predictive maintenance, to name just two. More broadly the proposed technologies will enable both corporations and public institutions to harvest large datasets at minimal cost.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project will design, develop, and deploy high-performance computing (HPC) software for unsupervised learning and anomaly detection. In the last decades tremendous successes in machine learning have been achieved in the area of supervised learning that requires compilation of large datasets with labels (for example, grouping of pictures based on the individual depicted on the image). In contrast, unsupervised learning algorithms do not require labels and thus require minimal human participation. However, due to significant technical difficulties they have not been as successful as supervised learning algorithms. This software package circumvents these difficulties and opens the way to scaling unsupervised learning algorithms to large and complex datasets. The main research and development challenges that will be addressed in this project are the ability to integrate this new technology with real world complex datasets through the choice of the correct comparison function between the objects of the dataset and the fully automatic algorithm and algorithm parameter selection.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Introduction:

 

RocketML, Inc. is the world’s first machine learning platform that enables near-real-time training of models regardless of data size or data type. It’s highly optimized framework comes with algorithms tuned to achieve upper limits of Amdahl’s law regardless of problem type.

 

RocketML supports efficient data parallelism, model parallelism, and their combination. DeepFusion is their unsupervised deep learning module developed with NSF funding. This module utilizes techniques ranging from self-supervised, semi-supervised to fully unsupervised, enabling several autonomous, robust machine learning pipelines without significant data labeling and other manual activities. 

Project Scope:

Enterprises collect and maintain vast amounts of structured and unstructured data. This growing amount of data drives substantial opportunities for machine learning. The main focus of the market has been on supervised learning methods like logistic regression, decision trees, random forests, support vector machines, and deep learning. If an enterprise cannot use one of the already trained machine learning models, it is very expensive to extract value from its data with existing supervised learning techniques. By contrast, unsupervised learning methods use unlabeled data to find  undiscovered patterns from superficially random data in huge datasets. The current market tools for unsupervised learning for generic data are very limited especially if one considers scalability to large datasets. This project addressed the broad need for reliable industrial scale algorithms that span a wide variety of unsupervised learning problems with multimodal/multivariate data.

 

In specific, we addressed the need for a "ready-to-use" turnkey solution that provides scalable and reliable algorithms that are tuned, tested, and bundled for high performance. Our key innovations are scalability with performance guarantees for the nearest neighbor, k-means clustering, and spectral clustering on large datasets; and deploying this framework on  Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Microsoft Azure used by the majority of enterprises for their machine learning workloads.

Notable Outcomes:

 

Among many commercially available parallel implementations of unsupervised algorithms, we considered and compared to Amazon Sagemaker KNN. RocketML consistently outperformed Amazon Sagemaker by 5-20x in training wall clock time on the same compute footprint.

 

We also compared our solution to Spotify’s Annoy. On a single node solution RocketML is 4x faster than Annoy and our advantage increases significantly as more nodes are added since Annoy does not scale.

 

The project resulted in a customer win in the Insurance industry for Natural language processing, where the model sizes required to achieve good accuracies were so big that it didn't into a single GPU memory and required parallel algorithms.

 

Lastly, we built a utility for on-the-fly creation of Parallel Cluster for Azure Cloud. We released this utility on Azure Machine Learning Marketplace which we think will benefit the High Performance Computing (HPC) community.


 

Applications:

 

Our software is valuable in many applications and industries. Here we list a small number of applications we are currently engaged in:

 

Energy Sector: Every year, Oil and Gas companies create large datasets of Seismic images in the hopes of discovering new oil and gas deposits. Interpretation of these images is challenging since labeling these dense, large image datasets is time consuming and expensive. Here our unsupervised learning methods help is automated image segmentation even on very large datasets in fraction of the time 

 

Medical Sector: CryoEM datasets which are used in vaccine and drug discovery are large and complex. Researchers have to go through several iterations of analysis, assembly and retesting before a scientifically sound conclusion is made. A complete biomolecule study using CryoEM could take around 9 months. RocketML unsupervised modules can help reduce the time to solution to days or hours. 

 

Financial Services Sector: Financial services sector has both time series related use cases where labeling is infeasible. Our unsupervised approach once can help improve accuracies without losing the explainability. In addition, the financial services sector is also dependent on big datasets (alternative data), mostly in the form of image and NLP (unstructured). Our system helps build effective fraud detection and other models without significant amounts of labeled data.

 

Cyber Security Sector: Network Behavior Anomaly Detection, Web traffic intelligence and Security, Identity and Access Management (IAM),Threat intelligence and management, Data Loss Prevention (DLP), Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) can all use highly scalable, fast training, unsupervised methods. We have been working with a few organizations to revolutionize the sector with “train-heavy, predict-light” approaches that is well suited with our platform.


 

 


Last Modified: 07/08/2020
Modified by: Vinay Rao
